page.title: 12LAND AROUND THE RIVER FROME
page.content: There is low land around many areas of the{R.Frome.}It is crossed by many streams and is wet all year round. This land is mainly used for cattle grazing but some cereal crops are grown on the higher land. The land to the south and west is owned by Duddle Farm and the land to the north and east is owned by Norris Mill Farm. Duddle Farm comprises of a large Georgian house and a few small farm buildings including a large metal barn. At the Bockhampton crossroads the Bockhampton road crosses the Dorchester-Tincleton road. The land rises in a NW direction putting the road from{Lower {Bockhampton}to{Higher Bockhampton}on a significant slope.
